message: Stuck on 5v no loop. Doide mode on CB151 those 3 capacitors is 0.012. I get 5.2v on PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR
Check voltage and diode mode readings on LDO rails of all CD3215 chips.

UB300  - PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO 3.3v
UB400  - PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO 3.3v
U3200  -  PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO 3.3v
U3100  -  PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO 3.3v

All diode mode reading 470
C7651 was missing someone before ripped it from the board i replaced it and rewired  PP5V_S5 line to U7650

"LDO rail[B][U]s[/U][/B]"
Each CD3215 has 4 LDOs...
LDO_1V8D , LDO_1V8A , LDO_3V3 and LDO_BMC ???
Sounds like LDOs, don't you think???
You're a funny person ;) :ROFLMAO:  thanks i'll revert

U3100
LDO_1V8D  - 1.8v diode 458
LDO_1V8A  - 1.8v diode 0.490
LDO_3V3    -  3.3v diode 0.484
LDO_BMC  -  0v     diode 0.484

U3200
LDO_3V3    -  3.3v diode 0.484
LDO_1V8A -  1.8v diode 0.489
LDO_1V8D -  1.8v diode 0.456
LDO_BMC  -  0v   diode 0.485

UB400
LDO_3V3 - 3.3v diode 0.480
LDO_1V8A - 1.8v diode 0.480
LDO_1V8D - 1.8v diode 0.460
LDO_BMC - 0v diode  0.480

LDO_3V3 - 3.3v diode 0.480
LDO_1V8A - 1.8v diode 0.500    
LDO_1V8D - 1.8v diode 0.476
LDO_BMC - 0v diode 0.487
Not sure if this line should have very low diode mode reading 0.012...

Not sure, compare with L2950.

LDO readings look normal.
Do you get voltage at 1V1_LDO lines?
Be aware, is only available on the powered port.
I measured one by one I don't get  1V1_LDO  on any of them voltage. I compared with another board and the diode mode reading on CB151/2/3 are not suppose to be like that
Also i removed the 3 caps and still same Low and goes to UB000

Lift the coil and check where the low value remains.
BTW, what is the value on L2950?
Diode Value on  L2950  both sides is 210 and on LB150 contact 2 diode is 0.016 which goes directly to some capacitors and UB000...

So you have a problem on LB150 area.
Both coils are placed on similar power rails.
UB000 is the first suspect...
I took out UB000 low resistance gone and i replaced it from another board same exact. The diode mode reading are now same from both sides but stuck on 5v still no power...

Possible that UB000 is not soldered good or some other issue... any ideas? 

Thanks

"Do you get voltage at 1V1_LDO lines?"
Check that now, after UB000 replaced.

U3200  1V1_LDO  on C3204 0v
U3100  1V1_LDO  on C3104 0v
UB300  1V1_LDO on  CB304 0v
UB400  1V1_LDO on  CB404 0v

All diode mode values on 1V1_LDO are correct
Be aware, 1V1 LDO must appear only on the powered port.
Yes I tried them all one by one :)

Then you still have problems on USB-C areas.

CD3215 chips good for sure?
Possibly bad solders, broken traces...
Nothing that seems as a possible problem when checked under microscope all of them seem fine nothing broken in that area. C7651 was broken off complete but i returned it in place
D6902on pin 2 i have 5v and i don't have PM_EN_P3V3_G3H Enable signal which comes from U7000
I replaced U7000 i got the EN signal still stuck on 5v o_O:ROFLMAO:

The U7000 that i replaced was used and not good probably i found old stock new U7000 replaced it after i git the EN signal on U6903 but the final solution was D6902 and got 20v powers on now.

Disclaimer:  No CD3215 were harmed during the repair  :cool: ??

Thanks for the help

You didn't say missing 3V3_G3H on earlier posts.
I forgot to ask about it also...
I was suppose to check it earlier but many devices on the table for work sometimes the brain goes awaaay :D Thanks either way appreciate it ?
